001package edu.pdx.cs410J.whitlock;
002
003import com.google.common.annotations.VisibleForTesting;
004
005import javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet;
006import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;
007import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse;
008import java.io.IOException;
009import java.io.PrintWriter;
010import java.util.HashMap;
011import java.util.Map;
012
013/**
014 * This servlet ultimately provides a REST API for working with an
015 * <code>Airline</code>.  However, in its current state, it is an example
016 * of how to use HTTP and Java servlets to store simple dictionary of words
017 * and their definitions.
018 */
019public class AirlineServlet extends HttpServlet {
020  static final String AIRLINE_NAME_PARAMETER = "airline";
021  static final String FLIGHT_NUMBER_PARAMETER = "flightNumber";
022
023  private final Map<String, Airline> airlines = new HashMap<>();
024
025  /**
026   * Handles an HTTP GET request from a client by writing the definition of the
027   * word specified in the "word" HTTP parameter to the HTTP response.  If the
028   * "word" parameter is not specified, all of the entries in the dictionary
029   * are written to the HTTP response.
030   */
031  @Override
032  protected void doGet( HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response ) throws IOException
033  {
034      response.setContentType( "text/plain" );
035
036      String airlineName = getParameter(AIRLINE_NAME_PARAMETER, request );
037      if (airlineName != null) {
038          dumpAirline(airlineName, response);
039
040      } else {
041          missingRequiredParameter(response, AIRLINE_NAME_PARAMETER);
042      }
043  }
044
045  /**
046   * Handles an HTTP POST request by storing the dictionary entry for the
047   * "word" and "definition" request parameters.  It writes the dictionary
048   * entry to the HTTP response.
049   */
050  @Override
051  protected void doPost( HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response ) throws IOException
052  {
053      response.setContentType( "text/plain" );
054
055      String airlineName = getParameter(AIRLINE_NAME_PARAMETER, request );
056      if (airlineName == null) {
057          missingRequiredParameter(response, AIRLINE_NAME_PARAMETER);
058          return;
059      }
060
061      String flightNumberString = getParameter(FLIGHT_NUMBER_PARAMETER, request );
062      if ( flightNumberString == null) {
063          missingRequiredParameter( response, FLIGHT_NUMBER_PARAMETER);
064          return;
065      }
066
067      Airline airline = getOrCreateAirline(airlineName);
068
069      airline.addFlight(new Flight(Integer.parseInt(flightNumberString)));
070
071      response.setStatus( HttpServletResponse.SC_OK);
072  }
073
074  /**
075   * Handles an HTTP DELETE request by removing all dictionary entries.  This
076   * behavior is exposed for testing purposes only.  It's probably not
077   * something that you'd want a real application to expose.
078   */
079  @Override
080  protected void doDelete(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException {
081      response.setContentType("text/plain");
082
083      this.airlines.clear();
084
085      PrintWriter pw = response.getWriter();
086      pw.println(Messages.allDictionaryEntriesDeleted());
087      pw.flush();
088
089      response.setStatus(HttpServletResponse.SC_OK);
090
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Writes an error message about a missing parameter to the HTTP response.
095   *
096   * The text of the error message is created by {@link Messages#missingRequiredParameter(String)}
097   */
098  private void missingRequiredParameter( HttpServletResponse response, String parameterName )
099      throws IOException
100  {
101      String message = Messages.missingRequiredParameter(parameterName);
102      response.sendError(HttpServletResponse.SC_PRECONDITION_FAILED, message);
103  }
104
105  /**
106   * Writes the definition of the given word to the HTTP response.
107   *
108   * The text of the message is formatted with {@link TextDumper}
109   */
110  private void dumpAirline(String word, HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException {
111    Airline airline = getAirline(word);
112
113    if (airline == null) {
114      response.setStatus(HttpServletResponse.SC_NOT_FOUND);
115
116    } else {
117      PrintWriter pw = response.getWriter();
118
119      TextDumper dumper = new TextDumper(pw);
120      dumper.dump(airline);
121
122      response.setStatus(HttpServletResponse.SC_OK);
123    }
124  }
125
126  /**
127   * Returns the value of the HTTP request parameter with the given name.
128   *
129   * @return <code>null</code> if the value of the parameter is
130   *         <code>null</code> or is the empty string
131   */
132  private String getParameter(String name, HttpServletRequest request) {
133    String value = request.getParameter(name);
134    if (value == null || "".equals(value)) {
135      return null;
136
137    } else {
138      return value;
139    }
140  }
141
142  @VisibleForTesting
143  Airline getOrCreateAirline(String airlineName) {
144    Airline airline = getAirline(airlineName);
145    if (airline == null) {
146      airline = new Airline(airlineName);
147      this.airlines.put(airlineName, airline);
148    }
149
150    return airline;
151  }
152
153  private Airline getAirline(String airlineName) {
154    return this.airlines.get(airlineName);
155  }
156}
